description: Borrowed from Hebrew אלף‎ (álef), with a Hellenized ph spelling due to influence from alpha. Doublet of alpha.

entries.meaning: The first letter of the Proto-Canaanite alphabet, and its descendants in descended Semitic scripts, such as Phoenician 𐤀‎ (ʾ, ʾaleph), Aramaic 𐡀‎ (ʾ), Classical Syriac ܐ‎ ('ālaph), Hebrew א‎ (aleph) and Arabic ا‎ (ʾalif).
